execution_plan.description: Compute per-country average profile-update turnaround (seconds) in the EU database for cases where the customer profile was updated after the order.
execution_plan.query: SELECT customers.country AS s1__country, AVG(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (customers.updated_at - orders.updated_at))) AS s1__avg_seconds, COUNT(orders.id) AS s1__count FROM customers JOIN orders ON orders.customer_id = customers.id WHERE customers.updated_at > orders.updated_at GROUP BY customers.country;

execution_plan.description: Compute per-country average profile-update turnaround (seconds) in the US database for cases where the customer profile was updated after the order.
execution_plan.query: SELECT customers.country AS s2__country, AVG(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (customers.updated_at - orders.updated_at))) AS s2__avg_seconds, COUNT(orders.id) AS s2__count FROM customers JOIN orders ON orders.customer_id = customers.id WHERE customers.updated_at > orders.updated_at GROUP BY customers.country;

execution_plan.description: Combine per-country averages from EU and US into a single dataset (one row per country per region source). The combined dataset will be used to determine the minimum average turnaround.
execution_plan.query: SELECT $step1.s1__country AS s3__country, $step1.s1__avg_seconds AS s3__avg_seconds, $step1.s1__count AS s3__count UNION ALL SELECT $step2.s2__country AS s3__country, $step2.s2__avg_seconds AS s3__avg_seconds, $step2.s2__count AS s3__count;
